intro: Mukdenia rossii f. multiloba, commonly known as the multilobed mukdenia, is a rare and unique plant species native to the temperate regions of East Asia. It is a member of the Rosaceae family, which includes roses and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, deeply lobed leaves and small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
